intro: Phymatopsis obtusa, commonly known as the broadleaf phymatosis, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its thick, fleshy roots and a basal rosette of broad, waxy leaves that help it conserve water in arid environments. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in terminal clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats. Phymatopsis obtusa is a hardy species adapted to extreme heat and drought conditions.
